greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest positive sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A002487(i) = A002487(j) and A278222(i) = A278222(j), for all i, j >= 0.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the ordered pair [A002487(n), A278222(n)].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences related to Stern's sequences
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ From A046523
xref: Cf. also A103391, A278243, A286378, A318311, A323892, A323897 and A324533 for a "deformed variant".
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 09 2019
